revised_title: August Krogh: A Life in Science and Exploration
tldr: The obituary of August Krogh, a renowned Danish physiologist, highlights his life, achievements, and contributions to the fields of physiology, zoology, and Arctic exploration. Krogh made significant discoveries in respiration, capillary circulation, and the exchange of gases in the lungs. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for Physiology and Medicine in 1920, and his work continues to influence the scientific community today.
